name: HighsHashTree
brief:
Adaptive hash-array mapped trie (HAMT) container

Cache-efficient hash map using trie structure with occupation bitmaps.

**Node Types:**
- InnerLeaf<SizeClass>: Leaf with 6-54 entries (4 size classes)
- BranchNode: Internal node with 64-way branching via hash chunks
- ListLeaf: Collision list at maximum depth (rare)

**Hash Structure:**
- 6 bits per level → 64-way branching (kBranchFactor)
- Up to 9 depth levels (54 bits of 64-bit hash)
- Occupation bitmap tracks which children exist

**InnerLeaf Features:**
- Linear probing within leaf for hash collisions
- 16-bit hash prefix for fast filtering
- Size class promotion/demotion on insert/erase

**Burst Behavior:**
- Leaf bursts to branch when exceeding kLeafBurstThreshold (54)
- Branch merges back to leaf when children fit in threshold

**Key Methods:**
- insert/insert_or_get(): Add entry, return value pointer
- find(): Lookup by key
- erase(): Remove entry
- find_common(): Find intersection with another tree
- for_each(): Iterate all entries

**Usage:**
Used for lifting opportunities in presolve (HPresolve.liftingOpportunities)
